abstracts.cdata!:
The Hydrocarbon Transport and Processing
            Project 's overall outcome is rated as satisfactory.
            The alternative means of transportation provided by the
            pipelines eased the pressure on roads and ports and helped
            to reduce the cost of fuels. The installation of the Hydro
            treatment Plant helped to reduce the import of low sulfur
            diesel oil and improved the environmental performance of the
            refinery. Key lessons learned are: a) when preparing the
            schedule for the execution of a project, the time for
            congressional approval, if required, should be considered;
            b) to avoid execution delays due to procurement processing,
            during appraisal a complete analysis should be made of the
            internal procedures and procurement practices of the
            borrower, especially when it is a large corporation with
            well established practices and procedures, in order to
            coordinated them with Bank's procurement guidelines; c)
            as energy sector reforms take usually longer than expected,
            the Bank should be ready to extend closing dates beyond the
            usual terms if the benefits of the continued dialogue with
            the authorities override the administrative costs of keeping
            the loan open; and d) the increasing availability of
            project-related information in the Bank's Internet
            pages is highly improving the interface between the Bank and
            its clients.
